required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy Study of Two Influenza Vaccines and Placebo in Healthy Adult Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Observer-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter Study to Assess Clinical Efficacy of a Cell-Derived Subunit Influenza Vaccine and an Egg-Derived Subunit Influenza Vaccine in the 2007-2008 Influenza Season in Healthy Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The present study will evaluate clinical efficacy, safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of both Novartis Vaccines' cell-derived influenza vaccine and egg-derived influenza vaccine in healthy adults 18 to 49 years of age.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Culture-Confirmed Influenza Illness Caused by Vaccine-like Strains
primary_outcome.description: The vaccine efficacy of CCI and IVV vaccines was estimated relative to Placebo group as the number of subjects prevented against virus-confirmed symptomatic influenza illness caused by each of three vaccine-like virus strains.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Culture-confirmed Influenza Illness Caused by Non-Vaccine Like Strains
secondary_outcome.description: The vaccine efficacy of CCI and IVV vaccines was estimated relative to placebo group as the number of subjects prevented against virus-confirmed symptomatic influenza A or B illness caused by non-vaccine-like strains.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Influenza Caused by Vaccine-like and Non-vaccine-like Strains
secondary_outcome.description: The vaccine efficacy of CCI and IVV vaccines was estimated relative to placebo as the number of subjected prevented against virus-confirmed symptomatic influenza A or B illness caused by vaccine-like and non-vaccine-like strains.

secondary_outcome.measure: Influenza-Associated Days in Bed, All Subjects
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects in this analysis included all subjects in the per protocol efficacy population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Influenza-Associated Days in Bed, Subset of Subjects With Virus-Confirmed- Influenza
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis was done among the subset of subjects in the per protocol efficacy population who had culture-confirmed influenza.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number Of Medical Visits (Inpatient and Outpatient) Due to Influenza Illness or Symptoms of Influenza, All Subjects
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects in this analysis included all subjects in the per protocol efficacy population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Medical Visits (Inpatient and Outpatient), Subset of Subjects With Virus-Confirmed-Influenza
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis was done among the subset of subjects in the per protocol efficacy population who had culture-confirmed influenza.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days of Usual Activity (i.e. Job, School,Household/Family/Community Activities) Lost Due to Influenza Disease, All Subjects
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects in this analysis included all subjects in the per protocol efficacy population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days of Usual Activity (i.e. Job, School,Household/Family/Community Activities) Lost, Subset of Subjects With Virus-Confirmed-Influenza
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis was done among the subset of subjects in the per protocol efficacy population who had culture-confirmed influenza.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects Who Achieved HI Titers ≥40 After One Vaccination of Either Cell-culture Derived or Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine or Placebo
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before vaccination (day 1) and three weeks after vaccination (day 22)
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the percentage of subjects achieving HI titers ≥40 at baseline (day 1) and three weeks after (day 22) one vaccination of either cell-culture or egg-derived vaccine or placebo for each of the three influenza vaccine strains (A/H1N1, A/H3N2 and B), evaluated using hemagglutination inhibition (HI) egg-derived antigen assay. This criterion is met according to US (CBER) guideline if the lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI for the percentage of subjects achieving HI titers ≥40 is ≥70%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Vaccination of Either Cell-culture Derived or Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine or Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: As per the CBER guideline, seroconversion is defined as the percentage of subjects with a prevaccination HI titer <10, a postvaccination titer ≥40; or in subjects with prevaccination HI titer ≥10, a ≥4-fold increase in postvaccination HI antibody titer. According to CBER criteria, the lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI for the percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion for HI antibody titer at day 22 met exceeded 40%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reported Solicited Local and Systemic Reactions up to 7 Days After Vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: The solicited local and systemic reactogenicity were collected up to 7 days after vaccination for all three vaccine groups.

arm_group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell culture-derived influenza vaccine.
Subjects received one dose of the trivalent egg-derived influenza vaccine.
Subjects received one dose of phosphate buffered solution (PBS).

intervention.description: One dose (0.5 mL) of cell culture-derived influenza vaccine, administered in the deltoid muscle.
One dose (0.5 mL) of the trivalent egg-derived influenza virus vaccine, administered in the deltoid muscle.
One dose (0.5 mL) of phosphate buffered solution.

results_reference.citation: Frey S, Vesikari T, Szymczakiewicz-Multanowska A, Lattanzi M, Izu A, Groth N, Holmes S. Clinical efficacy of cell culture–derived and egg‐derived inactivated subunit influenza vaccines in healthy adults. Clin Infect Dis. 2010 Nov 1;51(9):997-1004. doi: 10.1086/656578.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled at multiple centres in the US, Poland and Finland.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All enrolled subjects were included in the trial.

group.title: CCI Vaccine
group.description: One dose of cell culture-derived influenza vaccine.

group.title: IVV Vaccine
group.description: One dose of the trivalent egg-derived influenza virus vaccine.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: One dose of phosphate buffered solution (PBS).

group.title: CCI Vaccine
group.description: One dose of cell culture-derived influenza vaccine.

group.title: IVV Vaccine
group.description: One dose of the trivalent egg-derived influenza virus vaccine.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: One dose of phosphate buffered solution (PBS).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Culture-Confirmed Influenza Illness Caused by Vaccine-like Strains
outcome.description: The vaccine efficacy of CCI and IVV vaccines was estimated relative to Placebo group as the number of subjects prevented against virus-confirmed symptomatic influenza illness caused by each of three vaccine-like virus strains.
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on per protocol (PP) efficacy population i.e. the subjects in the exposed efficacy population who correctly received the vaccine and provided evaluable swab samples at the relevant time points.

group.title: CCI Vaccine
group.description: One dose of cell culture-derived influenza vaccine.

group.title: IVV Vaccine
group.description: One dose of the trivalent egg-derived influenza virus vaccine.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: One dose of phosphate buffered solution (PBS).

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Culture-Confirmed Influenza Illness Caused by Vaccine-like Strains
measure.description: The vaccine efficacy of CCI and IVV vaccines was estimated relative to Placebo group as the number of subjects prevented against virus-confirmed symptomatic influenza illness caused by each of three vaccine-like virus strains.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on per protocol (PP) efficacy population i.e. the subjects in the exposed efficacy population who correctly received the vaccine and provided evaluable swab samples at the relevant time points.

analysis.groups_desc: Vaccine efficacy (VE) of CCI vaccine vs. Placebo (Overall) Simultaneous one-sided 97.5% confidence interval (CI) for the VE of CCI vaccine relative to Placebo was based on the Sidak-corrected score CIs for the two relative risks.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-values are from score statistic with Sidak correction testing the null hypothesis that the VE of CCI vs. placebo is <= 40% (the relative risk, >= 0.60). If adjusted p-value is <0.025, then the comparison is statistically significant.

analysis.groups_desc: Vaccine efficacy (VE) of CCI vaccine vs. Placebo for A/H1N1 strain Simultaneous one-sided 97.5% confidence interval (CI) for the VE of CCI vaccine relative to Placebo was based on the Sidak-corrected score CIs for the two relative risks.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-values are from score statistic with Sidak correction testing the null hypothesis that the VE of CCI vs. placebo is <= 40% (the relative risk, >= 0.60). If adjusted p-value is <0.025, then the comparison is statistically significant.

analysis.groups_desc: Vaccine efficacy (VE) of CCI vaccine vs. Placebo for A/H3N2 strain. Simultaneous one-sided 97.5% confidence interval (CI) for the VE of CCI vaccine relative to Placebo was based on the Sidak-corrected score CIs for the two relative risks.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-values are from score statistic with Sidak correction testing the null hypothesis that the VE of CCI vs. placebo is <= 40% (the relative risk, >= 0.60). If adjusted p-value is <0.025, then the comparison is statistically significant.
analysis.method_desc: For strain A/H3N2, the vaccine efficacy of the CCI vaccine vs. placebo was not evaluable since no influenza case was observed in the placebo group.

analysis.groups_desc: Vaccine efficacy (VE) of CCI vaccine vs. Placebo for B strain Simultaneous one-sided 97.5% confidence interval (CI) for the VE of CCI vaccine relative to Placebo was based on the Sidak-corrected score CIs for the two relative risks.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-values are from score statistic with Sidak correction testing the null hypothesis that the VE of CCI vs. placebo is <= 40% (the relative risk, >= 0.60). If adjusted p-value is <0.025, then the comparison is statistically significant.

analysis.method_desc: For strain A/H3N2, the vaccine efficacy of the IVV vaccine vs. placebo was not evaluable since no influenza case was observed in the placebo group.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects Who Achieved HI Titers ≥40 After One Vaccination of Either Cell-culture Derived or Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine or Placebo
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the percentage of subjects achieving HI titers ≥40 at baseline (day 1) and three weeks after (day 22) one vaccination of either cell-culture or egg-derived vaccine or placebo for each of the three influenza vaccine strains (A/H1N1, A/H3N2 and B), evaluated using hemagglutination inhibition (HI) egg-derived antigen assay. This criterion is met according to US (CBER) guideline if the lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI for the percentage of subjects achieving HI titers ≥40 is ≥70%.
outcome.time_frame: Before vaccination (day 1) and three weeks after vaccination (day 22)
outcome.population: Analysis was done on a subset of subjects who constituted the PP immunogenicity population.

group.title: CCI Vaccine
group.description: One dose of cell culture-derived influenza vaccine.

group.title: IVV Vaccine
group.description: One dose of the trivalent egg-derived influenza virus vaccine.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: One dose of phosphate buffered solution (PBS).

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects Who Achieved HI Titers ≥40 After One Vaccination of Either Cell-culture Derived or Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine or Placebo
measure.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the percentage of subjects achieving HI titers ≥40 at baseline (day 1) and three weeks after (day 22) one vaccination of either cell-culture or egg-derived vaccine or placebo for each of the three influenza vaccine strains (A/H1N1, A/H3N2 and B), evaluated using hemagglutination inhibition (HI) egg-derived antigen assay. This criterion is met according to US (CBER) guideline if the lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI for the percentage of subjects achieving HI titers ≥40 is ≥70%.
measure.population: Analysis was done on a subset of subjects who constituted the PP immunogenicity population.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Vaccination of Either Cell-culture Derived or Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine or Placebo
outcome.description: As per the CBER guideline, seroconversion is defined as the percentage of subjects with a prevaccination HI titer <10, a postvaccination titer ≥40; or in subjects with prevaccination HI titer ≥10, a ≥4-fold increase in postvaccination HI antibody titer. According to CBER criteria, the lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI for the percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion for HI antibody titer at day 22 met exceeded 40%.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on a subset of subjects who constituted the PP immunogenicity population.

group.title: CCI Vaccine
group.description: One dose of cell culture-derived influenza vaccine.

group.title: IVV Vaccine
group.description: One dose of the trivalent egg-derived influenza virus vaccine.

group.title: Placebo

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Vaccination of Either Cell-culture Derived or Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine or Placebo
measure.description: As per the CBER guideline, seroconversion is defined as the percentage of subjects with a prevaccination HI titer <10, a postvaccination titer ≥40; or in subjects with prevaccination HI titer ≥10, a ≥4-fold increase in postvaccination HI antibody titer. According to CBER criteria, the lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI for the percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion for HI antibody titer at day 22 met exceeded 40%.
measure.population: Analysis was done on a subset of subjects who constituted the PP immunogenicity population.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reported Solicited Local and Systemic Reactions up to 7 Days After Vaccination
outcome.description: The solicited local and systemic reactogenicity were collected up to 7 days after vaccination for all three vaccine groups.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on Safety population i.e. all subjects in the exposed population who provide post vaccination safety data.

group.title: CCI Vaccine
group.description: One dose of cell culture-derived influenza vaccine.

group.title: IVV Vaccine
group.description: One dose of the trivalent egg-derived influenza virus vaccine.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: One dose of phosphate buffered solution (PBS).

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reported Solicited Local and Systemic Reactions up to 7 Days After Vaccination
measure.description: The solicited local and systemic reactogenicity were collected up to 7 days after vaccination for all three vaccine groups.
measure.population: Analysis was done on Safety population i.e. all subjects in the exposed population who provide post vaccination safety data.

reported_events.time_frame: Serious Adverse Events were collected throughout the study period (i.e., 6 months).
reported_events.desc: The analysis was done on the safety population.

group.title: CCI Vaccine
group.description: One dose of cell culture-derived influenza vaccine.

group.title: IVV Vaccine
group.description: One dose of the trivalent egg-derived influenza virus vaccine.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: One dose of phosphate buffered solution (PBS).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
